title: Product Design, Mechanical Engineering and Materials Internships
summary: At Apple, new ideas have a way of becoming extraordinary products, services, and customer experiences very quickly.
description: Responsibilities may include: • Provide support to design, engineering, prototyping and validation activities for all hardware product lines • Help to create the next generation of the world's finest hardware devices • Conceive, design, and bring into production products that will re-define user experience • Work closely with many different multi-functional teams, including Industrial Design, Packaging, Safety, Hardware Engineering, EMC, and Marketing
preferred_qualifications: It’s helpful if you meet one or more of the following qualifications, but it isn’t a requirement: Product design experience (preferably consumer electronics), Experience working with component modules (LCD assemblies, batteries, camera modules, etc.) and their interconnect (FPC design and ACF bonding), Knowledge of materials science fundamentals for plastic, adhesive, metal, glass, ceramic, composite, and coating materials, Ability to use statistical tools and techniques, Knowledge of finite element analysis theory and general mechanical engineering analysis, Ability in plastic, metal, composite, and glass/ceramic part design, 3-D CAD skills, Experience in Design for Manufacturability (DFM), Design for Assembly (DFA), statistical tolerance analysis techniques, functional dimensioning, and geometric tolerancing, Handheld, portable and/or hardware experience, Knowledge and understanding of the integration of wireless antenna (GSM, GPS, Wifi) into mechanical enclosures, Knowledge and understanding of the design of audio subsystems (microphone, speaker, receiver), Proficiency in Unigraphics or Pro-engineer, Ability to work in a team-based environment, Ability to be proactive and take initiative, Strong analytical and problem solving skills, Flexibility and adaptability, Ability to work on multiple requests/tests at the same time, Excellent written and verbal communication skills
